SENT.plain: A technically adequate four-vessel cerebral angiogram was normal on the first day after a typical episode of subarachnoid hemorrhage
The study was repeated 40 days later showing a large aneurysm of the basilar bifurcation
Hypothetically, the first attempt to visualize the aneurysm was negative due to early transitory thrombosis of the aneurysmal sac
In some cases of subarachnoid hemorrhage it is beneficial to repeat previously normal angiographic studies
